event: Earliest human presence in the Low Countries after Ice Age retreat
Celtic and Germanic tribes inhabit the river deltas
Roman rule organizes the southern Low Countries
Roman authority collapses during the Migration Period
Frankish rule integrates the region into Carolingian Europe
Land reclamation and dike building expand habitable territory
Dutch cities flourish through trade and maritime commerce

Northern provinces declare independence from Spain
Treaty of Westphalia recognizes Dutch independence
Dutch Golden Age peaks in trade, art, and science
Dutch East India Company is founded, pioneering global trade empire
French invasion marks the end of Dutch dominance in Europe
French revolutionary forces overthrow the old republic
Kingdom of the Netherlands is established after Napoleonâ€™s defeat
Belgium separates from the Netherlands
Liberal constitution establishes parliamentary democracy
Nazi Germany occupies the Netherlands during World War II
Indonesia gains independence, ending the Dutch colonial empire
